111.heading: Foster, Harold, 1892-1982--Miscellanea.
111.title: "Flashback"
111.author: David Folkman
111.appears_in: p. 12 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).
notes: Folkman surveyed cartoonists in 1967, asking about the importance of art education to the career. Terse responses from Charles Schulz, Hal Foster, Mort Walker, Milton Caniff, Zack Mosley, Chic Young, Lank Leonard, Ed Dodd, Irv Phillips, Walter Berndt, Don Tobin, Al Smith, and Bud Sagendorf.

112.heading: Foster, Harold, 1892-1982--Miscellanea.
112.title: "Flashback"
112.author: David Folkman
112.appears_in: p. 12 in Hogan's Alley, no. 10 (=v. 3, no. 2) (Summer 2002).
notes: A survey question, "How did you first come up with the idea for your strip, and how much preliminary research did you do before attempting to start it?" is answered briefly by Hal Foster, Ernie Bushmiller, Charles M. Schulz, Otto Soglow, Mort Walker, Chic Young, Milton Caniff, Bud Sagendorf, Lank Leonard, Ed Dodd, and Irv Philipps.
